intro: Hemitelia integrifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are typically smooth and entire. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
